PROCUREMENT OF CONSTRUCTION OF COMMUNITY WATER SUPPLY DOWNSTREAM OF THIKA DAM-GATANGA WATER SUPPLY
description: The Scope of Works Entailed: 1. Mass concrete weir intake across Kiama and Kimakia Rivers, capacity 3000m3/d 2. Approximately 35km of DN 160-DN225mm uPVC raw water and treatment water pipelines. 3. Construction of 3000m3 /day water treatment plants each consisting of mixing chamber, 4 sedimentation tanks, 2 Rapid Sand filter beds, 150m3 clear water tank and 225m3 elevated backwash tank 4. Chlorination building, pump house and generators room. 5. Power mains supply and electrical works 6. Ancillary works at the treatment works consisting of access roads, street lighting, site drainage and fencing.

CONSULTANCY SERVICES FOR DESIGN, REVIEW AND SUPERVISION AND COORDINATION OF WORKS FOR KISERIAN SEWERAGE WORKS
description: 1. To fulfil the role of the Engineer's Representative in the supervision of the construction works; 2. To supervise Kiserian Sewerage Project, in accordance with the conditions of contract, specifications and drawings, works carried out by the selected contractor. The consultant will be responsible for ensuring that work is carried out in accordance with the designs, specifications and works contract documents while at all - time ensuring quality, cost effectiveness and timely completion; 3. To provide the client with regular status reports and other reports as per the Terms of Reference, together with all related necessary technical assistance and professional advice to the Client related to supervision of the construction of the said works; To assist in the implementation of Resettlement of Project Affected Persons (RAP).

description: The Scope of Works Entailed: 1. Phase A- Detailed Design and Tender documentation for the proposed raw water gravity main from Thika dam to the proposed Water Treatment Plant (WTP) at Ngorongo and the proposed treated water gravity main up from Ngorongo to Kabete reservoirs. Capacity 1.60m3/s. 2. Phase B- (Based on satisfactory performance of Phase A): Construction supervision for the proposed new raw and treated water transmission pipelines designed under Phase A.
